title: Larix decidua 'Julian's Weeper', 2019 photo
description: Larix decidua 'Julian's Weeper', 2019 photo, Common Name: Weeping Eurorean Larch, Size: #Conifer, Light Green, USDA Hardiness Zone 3, Michigan Bloom Month x, In Garden Bed HR-D for 37.1 YEARS (HLG). Planted in 1982. American Conifer Society: Larix decidua ‘Julian’s Weeper’ is a strong-growing strictly weeping selection of European larch that will form a low mound of branches unless its leaders are staked up. With diligent care it can be trained to become a spectacular cascade with branches weeping to the ground. It could even be trained to grow on a rounded arch over a walkway for an elegant effect. This cultivar originated as a seedling selected in 1982 by Yamina Rare Plants Nursery, Monbulk, Victoria, Australia. MSU Hidden Lake Gardens, Harper Collection of Rare & Dwarf Conifers #Larix #EuroreanLarch www.flickr.com/search/?user_id=50697352%40N00&sort=da...
